poem:
Title: "On Viewing Steve: A Martinned Laughter"

Staccato clips, a life framed,
In sonorous echoes and archived jest,
Irony's child moonwalking past pain.
His eyes mirror laughter, underpropped by past,
Humour's chiaroscuro layers, click, click, click,
Uttered in the apple-tinted silence.
Yet, within the intimate reels
Lies father's disappointment, etched deep,
A comedy King, a son unpleased.
Crowned in light, shaded by ghosts,
Morgan's lens narrates - a reluctant confession.
